Docs.summary: Contains the collection of controls that the uses.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Forms.TabPage owner) cil managed

Docs.param: The that contains this collection of controls.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Add(class System.Windows.Forms.Control value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Adds a control to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The specified control is added to the end of the collection. If the control is already a child of another control, it is removed from the other control.
## Examples The following code example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabControl> with one <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TabPage>. This example uses the Add method to add a single control, `button1`, to the `tabPage1`. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Controls%2A> property is used to get the `tabPage1` controls collection to add controls to the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Drawing> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms> namespaces for this example.
